intro: Gilibertia filipes, commonly known as the hairy false gourd, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Gilibertia filipes is often found in disturbed habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
